title: Ukraine releases purported communications of Russian commander
description: A chilling threat has emerged for the residents of Mariupol after the release of a purported communications intercept of a Russian ground unit commander. CNN's Matt Rivers has more on the battle of Mariupol.

title: This is the devastation Russian occupation left behind in Borodianka
description: CNN's Jake Tapper and his team visited the Ukrainian town of Borodianka after weeks of Russian occupation left it devastated.

title: Netflix's bad year just got worse
description: Netflix's bad year just got worse.

title: US Treasury Secretary: This is what's hurting pandemic recovery
description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen says the war in Ukraine poses an economic threat that's contributing to inflation and hurting recovery from the pandemic.

title: 'I am done talking': Former MSNBC analyst now fighting in Ukraine
description: Malcolm Nance, a former national security analyst for MSNBC, went on "The ReidOut" to explain why he joined the International Legion of Territorial Defense of Ukraine.

title: Why Joe Biden's poll numbers aren't getting any better
description: In today's episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza breaks down President Joe Biden's dismal poll numbers and what they could mean for Democrats in 2022.

title: Why Donbas is key to Putin's ideology and strategy
description: Russia's war on Ukraine has turned toward the country's eastern industrial region of Donbas. Vladimir Putin appears determined to occupy the region and bring it into Russia's sphere of influence. But why?

title: CDC mask mandate struck down
Football world sends condolences to Ronaldo and family following news of his baby son's death
description: The football world has been offering support and sympathy to Manchester United star Cristiano Ronaldo and his family following the announcement on Monday of his baby son's death.

title: 'Hugely exciting': 400-year-old painting found in storeroom could be worth millions
description: A 400-year-old Dutch master painting which experts believe could be worth millions of dollars has been discovered in a storeroom in Australia.

title: New York Times names Joe Kahn as executive editor
description: Joe Kahn, the managing editor of The New York Times, will succeed Dean Baquet as executive editor in June.

title: Johnny Depp expected to take stand in defamation case against Amber Heard
description: Johnny Depp is expected to take the stand on Tuesday in his defamation case against his ex-wife Amber Heard.

title: Four of the NFL's best quarterbacks feature in latest edition of 'The Match'
description: Looking forward to seeing Tom Brady in action? The wait is nearly over -- well, on a golf course at least.

title: All-private SpaceX astronaut mission to return home from the ISS
description: The first all-private mission to the International Space Station is slated to complete the final leg of its journey this week, capping off what will be about a 12-day, multimillion-dollar journey.

title: Elon Musk thinks Twitter's algorithm should be public. Here's what that could mean
description: On March 24, weeks before he offered to buy Twitter, Elon Musk posted a poll on the social media platform: "Twitter algorithm should be open source," he wrote, with options for users to vote "yes" or "no."

title: The most dangerous person in the world: A young man who's broke and alone
description: Masculinity: It's a societal construct based on norms and behaviors we expect from boys and men. But it's been incorrectly conflated with toxicity. I think it's interesting right up front to define what it means to be a man.

title: IMF says Russia's war in Ukraine will 'severely set back' global economy
description: The International Monetary Fund has slashed its expectations for global economic growth over the next two years because of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, comparing the ripple effects from the conflict to an "earthquake."

title: Hunger and anger in Shanghai's unending lockdown nightmare
description:
• Shanghai's low official Covid death toll raises questions outside China
• Lockdowns cast pall over China's economy

title: Copycat packaging of marijuana edibles poses risk to children, study says
description: At first glance, it looks like a single serving bag of Nerds Rope that your child might eat as a treat. But take a closer look. See the word "medicated" and the small white box at the bottom that says 600 milligrams of THC?

title: At least six dead as multiple explosions hit Kabul schools
description: Multiple explosions rocked schools in western Kabul on Tuesday, leaving an unknown number of casualties, according to police and witnesses.

title: The world may dodge another recession. But risks are growing
description: As the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund kick off their spring meetings this week, both are sounding a warning: The global economy, they say, is quickly losing steam.

title: She's a tennis grand slam title winner and played pro cricket. Now Ash Barty will feature in a leading golf event
description: Just a month after she shocked the tennis world by announcing her retirement from the sport, former world No.1 Ashleigh Barty is returning to the spotlight with a golf club instead of a racket in hand.

title: Their teenage children died by suicide. Now these families want to hold social media companies accountable
description: Christopher James Dawley, known as CJ to his friends and family, was 14 years old when he signed up for Facebook, Instagram and Snapchat. Like many teenagers, he documented his life on those platforms.

title: Why the Republican offensive on abortion is escalating
description: When three red states finalized severe restrictions on abortion over consecutive days last week, they highlighted the GOP's rising militancy on the issue -- and the political and legal calculations underpinning it.

title: 'My kid's teeth are starting to spoil': Children hiding from Russian bombardment in basement
description: Dozens of children are said to have been sheltering for weeks in a basement in the besieged Ukrainian city of Mariupol. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

title: Putin gives honorary title to Russian brigade accused of war crimes in Bucha
description: A brigade accused of committing war crimes in the Ukrainian town of Bucha has been awarded an honorary title by Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Russian actor speaks out after mother disowns him for not supporting war in Ukraine
description: Russian actor and model Jean-Michel Shcherbak shares the heartbreaking message he received from his mother, denouncing him as her son for not supporting Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Boxer Amir Khan says he was robbed at gunpoint in London
description: Boxer Amir Khan says was he robbed at gunpoint on Monday while he was out in London with wife Faryal Makhdoom.

title: A Ukrainian-American woman's family were forced to flee to Russia. She smuggled them to Poland
description: Mila Turchyn walks into a McDonald's parking lot near the Poland-Ukraine border. She is anxious. She doesn't trust the man she is about to meet. He is a smuggler.

title: Steph Curry torches Denver Nuggets as Golden State Warriors extend lead in playoff series
description: Steph Curry blew away the Denver Nuggets on Monday night as he begins to resemble the offensive supernova he has become over the years.

title: Plans for New York's largest 'all-electric' skyscraper unveiled
description: American banking giant JPMorgan Chase has unveiled plans for its new global headquarters: a 60-story skyscraper powered entirely by renewable energy.

title: Man arrested after a California high school student was fatally stabbed by an intruder, police say
description: A man has been arrested in connection with the stabbing death of a 15-year-old girl at a high school in Stockton, California, Monday, police said.

title: Video shows seniors being transferred to government isolation wards in Shanghai
description: Chinese Vice Premier Sun Chunlan has vowed to send anyone in Shanghai who tests positive for Covid-19 and any close contacts to government-designated quarantine sites "without exception, deduction and delay," according to authorities. CNN's Steven Jiang reports.

title: Japan researchers develop electric chopsticks to enhance salty taste
description: Japanese researchers have developed computerized chopsticks that enhance salty tastes, potentially helping those who need to reduce sodium in their diets.

title: See how experts measure glacier melt in Iceland
description: One of the most iconic images of the climate crisis is melting ice and, in some parts of the world, it can lead to catastrophic flooding. But how exactly does that happen? CNN explains the science behind rising sea levels and what effect they have on our world.﻿

title: The world's most over-the-top cruise ship cabins
description: What's it like sailing the seas at the very height of luxury?

title: New photos show Russian warship Moskva before it sank
description: New photos and a short video clip emerged early Monday on social media showing Russia's guided-missile cruiser, the Moskva, badly damaged and on fire in the hours before the ship sunk in the Black Sea on Thursday.

title: Challenge to Marjorie Taylor Greene's candidacy can move forward, federal judge rules
description: A federal judge on Monday cleared the way for a coalition of liberal groups to move forward with their attempt to disqualify controversial GOP Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene from running for reelection, based on claims that she aided the January 6 insurrectionists.

title: He sat in the audience at 'Britain's Got Talent.' Then his daughters surprised him on stage
description: A father thought he was taking his family to watch a taping of "Britain's Got Talent." But then, his daughters walked onto the stage. Watch his emotional tribute to them.

title: Family color codes triplets to tell them apart
description: A Wisconsin mom of identical triplets paints her boys' big toenails to color code the kids and tell them apart. CNN's Jeanne Moos speaks with the triplets' aunt, Amy Jo Hasselquist, about the family's colorful hack.

title: Most of Europe now on US travel 'high' risk list
description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention unveiled its new system for travel risk assessments on Monday.
